text: <@U3L7A68JC> So I was thinking about something that has came up a few times in card discussions with you regarding consistency. I think me saying card X isn't consistent enough isn't the right wording. It's not that Bribery isn't consistent enough for me, or that Sun Titan isn't, but it's that they don't fit into the scheme of whatever the deck I'm playing is trying to do. I don't want my deck to win so much as I want it to win the way I want it to win.
So it's not quite that Bribery isn't consistent enough so much as it is it's not consistent with my deck and what it's trying to do
It's not that Sun Titan isn't a value generator but it's that it isn't generating the value I want my particular deck to generate.

If I wanted to win via theft in a particular deck I'd be running Bribery, or if I was playing a deck built around recursion I'd be using Sun Titan, but I don't want them just as generic value generator.
consistent theme vs consistent effects
It's also probably why I don't run many green creature tutors. I'm building a deck that has a lot of cogs in the machine and there generally isn't one cog I need more than another
git gud stuff
i do prefer games where something different happens every game, which is also why i like commander over other mtg formats.
so i don't always use the same good stuff, since i'm just sick of seeing some of it
I intentionally have one blue deck with no counters, one green deck with no green ramp, etc.
Also to be clear I'm not saying my way is right or wrong, I'm just explaining my own personal logic on it

as a note <@U4V5EHQ2G>, perhaps the biggest reason why you find it hard to cut your black draw spells and such is because you want that consistency. I would perhaps consider trading out one of those draw spells for a tutor and see how it feels in terms of consistency of effects
Then I'd just tutor for draw, lol
I think another problem is that you’re just not a combo player
you’re a synergy player
Nothing wrong with that. I get what you’re saying now <@U4V5EHQ2G>.
<@U3RJ9VDRT> is a filthy combo player.
no, nothing wrong
almost all my decks start with no draw and have almost all tutors
Ugh.
until I find out how the deck plays out to know where along the line of control/aggro it is
I've also yet to lose a game where Swarm Intelligence hits the field. God that card is so, so good.
it’s a bunch of fun
I'm not even doing anything particularly degenerate with it in Talrand, but copying Chart a Course, Lat-Nam's Legacy, Impulse and Perilous Research all in a turn just feels bonkers
I run it in wheels.dec for the same reason as hive mind, more wheels!
my only complaint about [[swarm intelligence]] is that it costs to much mana that I don’t want to copy my ramp spells at that point

text: it’s like, I want to cast you, but to get to you I need to ramp to get to you and you know what would help? you being out already so I can double my ramp
Swarm intelligence was always a win more card when I played it. I took it out of all my decks because I never actually caught me up, it just put me further ahead
it’s not a catch up card but a finisher
Depends on a lot on the deck. My talrand deck wins via drake swarm, and drawing more cantrips off my cantrips so I can cantrip into cantrips helps a lot
same with my wheels deck, wheeling so I can wheel to wheel is always very good
trostani anthems or elenda anthems?
As a trostani player I can verify trostani anthems is amazing, but Elenda anthems is so much more fun to play.
yeah, the both seem to have a lot going for them
trostani as a lot more token support, elenda has protection with her
It's worth noting that of the two the elenda removal package is head and shoulders above trostani. The only this is trostani has [[aura shards]], [[aura mutation]], etc.

that’d be good

so you can save your combo piece

draw your deck at next upkeep with engine and scepter and sol ring!
er, end step
or go real big and wheel, play this into a hive mind, exileing everyone’s hand, then end the turn with sundial

because when it dies, a spell is usually cast

I have neither, but it seems like an even more value oriented Meren type of deck.
Hive mind will shut down a storm/control player but as for slowing it down... not all the time. It’ll make things nutty but it can create a quick wrap up very fast as well lol
I've never seen that outcome, so I'll put that in the outliers, unless folks just scoop once you lay down the Hive.

text: I think it would be a fair deck. I mean if you build a deck to infinite off to win, is Infiniting off to tie any worst? If anything it’s harder lol
Why would you invalidate the entire game on purpose? The decks only purpose is to ensure no one wins/loses so why play?
That’s my win though. If I win or if I tie, other people still wouldn’t win the game just as much as if I won.
If I played sanguine bond, would it really be different then spore/limb?
I played my combo and it combo’d, causing the game to win and the other players didn’t win as they wanted. There’s not much of a difference of the play style
Game to end*
Folks played and the outcome of a winner happened. That’s expected and desired. To shoot for stalemate means you’re all wasting your time.
Think we just have different play groups for the most part. Competitive aside, we just play to sling spells. Seeing something unique is always refreshing for us
There’s a difference between unique and a time sink, but I think it goes back to me having so little time to play that anything that is a sink riles me.
I want to play magic and have my deck building and game play hopefully decide if the outcome.

And if your deck and skill beat my deck, you did what you were aimed to do... but if you lose to me and this probably garbage deck well... I’m sorry I deserve my tie/win XD

I always viewed Edh like playing sorry. Sure winning is fun but the real reason we play is for the fun and interaction with one another. No one (least for us) really cares about the win
I view it like sex; the other people involved should be enjoying themselves, too regardless of the finish order.
But if the people you’re playing with like the chaos and randomness and ties then who am I to judge?
I hope you don’t view it like sex because that means only one person involved finishes :P
There can be only one.
There can be only one.
Someone has to finish first....
It’s a race, right?

A buddy of mine is currently pretty far in the interview process for the play design team and has been talking with some of the current  play design/r&d folks and apparently for the gds3 type recruitment methods they want people who can fit that mold specifically. With open recruitment like this they don't want just random joe blows who don't understand what they're currently doing, they want people who can at least fall in line because with people who know how to push back against those rules they target those people specifically, they wouldn't need to gds those people. 

At least that's how I understood the whole process/distinction of what they're looking for
I just mean that they want someone who pays attention to detail, but not someone who’s a pedant
